item.title: Molecular Evolution of CDPKs in Plants and Protists: The Role of Ancestral Introns
item.description: Note on the evolutionary insights of CDPKs and CRKs through intron/exon analysis, proposing a monophyletic origin and highlighting the role of ancient intron-mediated gene fusion in the origin of CDPKs.

item.title: Decoding Ca²⁺ Signals Through Plant Protein Kinases
item.description: Overview of the plant-specific CDPK-SnRK superfamily, including CDPKs, CRKs, CCaMKs, SnRKs, and their Ca²⁺ regulatory mechanisms. Models of activation and functional diversity of Ca²⁺ decoding mechanisms are discussed.

item.description: Note on the differential calcium sensitivity among Arabidopsis CDPK isoforms, highlighting the diversity of activation mechanisms and implications for calcium signaling in plants.

item.title: Allosteric Activation of Toxoplasma CDPK1: A Splint Model for Kinase Regulation
item.description: A fascinating study revealing that TgCDPK1 is stabilized and activated via an allosteric mechanism involving its regulatory CAD domain, challenging classical models of calcium-dependent kinase activation.

item.title: Structural Insights into Apicomplexan CDPK Activation: A Calcium-Triggered Mechanism
item.description: A landmark structural study revealing how apicomplexan CDPKs (TgCDPK1/3, CpCDPK) undergo dramatic conformational changes upon calcium binding to shift from an autoinhibited to an active state.

item.title: The Calmodulin-Fused Kinase (CFK) Family: A Major System Converting Calcium Signals into Protein Phosphorylation in Plants
item.description: Notes on a 2017 Scientific Reports study proposing the Calmodulin-Fused Kinase (CFK) family as the principal system for converting calcium signals to protein phosphorylation responses in plants, based on deep phylogenetic analysis tracing their evolutionary origins and functional diversification.

item.description: Note on the detailed structural study of CDPK activation, focusing on apicomplexan CAD conformations (CpCDPK, PfCDPK3), offering new insight into a potentially universal activation mechanism for CDPKs.

item.title: Comparative Modeling Studies of the Calmodulin-like Domain of CDPK from Soybean
item.description: A 2000 PROTEINS paper exploring the structural modeling of the calmodulin-like domain (CLD) of soybean CDPK-α, revealing unique domain features and potential intramolecular regulatory mechanisms based on homology modeling and experimental validation.

item.title: Discovery of Calcium-Dependent Protein Kinase (CDPK) as a Calmodulin-like Kinase Family
item.description: A 1991 Science paper reporting the discovery of a soybean CDPK as a novel class of calcium-dependent kinases, providing structural and evolutionary insights that shaped the understanding of CDPKs as CaM-like autonomous calcium sensors.

item.title: Real-Time Imaging of CDPK Conformational Changes Reveals Calcium-Decoding Mechanisms in Planta
item.description: Notes on a 2023 The Plant Cell study that introduces a genetically encoded FRET-based biosensor to monitor real-time conformational changes of CDPKs (CPKs) in response to calcium signals in vivo, highlighting distinct calcium sensitivities of CPK21 and CPK23 in stress responses.

item.title: Structure of the Regulatory Apparatus of a Calcium-Dependent Protein Kinase (CDPK): A Novel Mode of Calmodulin-Target Recognition
item.description: A 2006 JMB study presenting the crystal structure of Arabidopsis CDPK’s regulatory domain, revealing a domain-swapped dimer and an unexpected mechanism of calmodulin-like domain (CaM-LD) recognition, challenging classical calmodulin-target models.

item.title: Dual Role of Calmodulin in CaMKII Autophosphorylation: Decoding Calcium Frequency
item.description: Note on the seminal 1994 paper unveiling calmodulin’s dual role in CaMKII autophosphorylation and proposing a model for calcium frequency decoding in neurons. Includes reflections on CDPK parallels and a comparative framework for calcium signaling kinases.

item.description: Notes on a 2004 JBC paper exploring differential roles of N- and C-lobes in the CaM-like domain (CaM-LD) of CDPK, uncovering distinct Ca2+ affinities and their role in regulating kinase activation through interactions with the junction domain.

item.title: Membrane Localization of a Rice Calcium-Dependent Protein Kinase (CDPK) Is Mediated by Myristoylation and Palmitoylation
item.description: Notes on a 2000 Plant Journal paper identifying dual lipid modifications — myristoylation and palmitoylation — as essential for membrane targeting of rice CDPK (OsCDPK2), marking the first report of such dual acylation in plant CDPKs.

item.title: Tobacco Calcium-Dependent Protein Kinases Are Differentially Phosphorylated In Vivo as Part of a Kinase Cascade That Regulates Stress Response
item.description: Notes on a 2010 JBC paper investigating in vivo phosphorylation of tobacco CDPKs (NtCDPK2 and NtCDPK3) in response to stress, revealing distinct intra- and inter-molecular phosphorylation events, N-terminal-specific regulation, and the critical role of membrane localization.
